metadata.title: CVE-2018-19790 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An open redirect was discovered in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.50, 2.8.xbefore 2.8.49, 3.x before 3.4.20, 4.0.x before 4.0.15, 4.1.x before 4.1.9and 4.2.x before 4.2.1. By using backslashes in the `_failure_path` inputfield of login forms, an attacker can work around the redirection targetrestrictions and effectively redirect the user to any domain after login.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-asset - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-browser-kit - 3.4.20+dfsg-1

criterions.comment: symfony package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.20+dfsg-1').
